situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The bear brings an oil tank for the frog. The beetle has 33 dollars. The chihuahua is named Tarzan. The flamingo invests in the company whose owner is the frog. The frog has 65 dollars. The frog is named Luna, and is watching a movie from 1982. The frog is a marketing manager. The rhino disarms the cougar. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If you are positive that you saw one of the animals disarms the cougar, you can be certain that it will also want to see the dugong. Rule2: The rhino will not want to see the dugong, in the case where the dragon does not create one castle for the rhino. Rule3: Regarding the frog, if it has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the chihuahua's name, then we can conclude that it suspects the truthfulness of the poodle. Rule4: Are you certain that one of the animals suspects the truthfulness of the ostrich and also at the same time suspects the truthfulness of the poodle? Then you can also be certain that the same animal refuses to help the fangtooth. Rule5: Regarding the frog, if it is watching a movie that was released after the Berlin wall fell, then we can conclude that it suspects the truthfulness of the ostrich. Rule6: Regarding the frog, if it has more money than the beetle, then we can conclude that it suspects the truthfulness of the ostrich. Rule7: In order to conclude that frog does not suspect the truthfulness of the poodle, two pieces of evidence are required: firstly the flamingo invests in the company owned by the frog and secondly the bear brings an oil tank for the frog. Rule2 is preferred over Rule1. Rule7 is preferred over Rule3.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the frog refuse to help the fangtooth?
label: unknown
